verses.kjv: Bel boweth down, Nebo stoopeth, their idols were upon the beasts, and upon the cattle: your carriages were heavy loaden; they are a burden to the weary beast.
verses.ct: Bel collapses, Nebo crumbles. Their idol statues are loaded onto pack animals and livestock. The things you used to carry around are now heavy loads, a burden for exhausted animals.

verses.kjv: They stoop, they bow down together; they could not deliver the burden, but themselves are gone into captivity.
verses.ct: Together they crumble and collapse. They couldn't even save their own cargo — they themselves have been hauled off into captivity.

verses.kjv: Hearken unto me, O house of Jacob, and all the remnant of the house of Israel, which are borne by me from the belly, which are carried from the womb:
verses.ct: Listen to me, descendants of Jacob, all you who remain of the nation of Israel — you whom I have supported since birth, whom I have carried since you came from the womb:

verses.kjv: And even to your old age I am he; and even to hoar hairs will I carry you: I have made, and I will bear; even I will carry, and will deliver you.
verses.ct: Even when you grow old, I am the same. Even when your hair turns gray, I will carry you. I made you, and I will sustain you; I will carry you and I will rescue you.

verses.kjv: To whom will ye liken me, and make me equal, and compare me, that we may be like?
verses.ct: Who would you compare me to? Who would you consider my equal? Who could you place alongside me as though we were the same?

verses.kjv: They lavish gold out of the bag, and weigh silver in the balance, and hire a goldsmith; and he maketh it a god: they fall down, yea, they worship.
verses.ct: Some people pour gold from their bags and weigh out silver on scales, then hire a metalworker who shapes it into a god. Then they bow down and worship it.

verses.kjv: They bear him upon the shoulder, they carry him, and set him in his place, and he standeth; from his place shall he not remove: yea, one shall cry unto him, yet can he not answer, nor save him out of his trouble.
verses.ct: They hoist it onto their shoulders and haul it around, then set it down in its spot, and there it stands. It never moves from that place. Someone may cry out to it, but it cannot respond or rescue anyone from their troubles.

verses.kjv: Remember this, and shew yourselves men: bring it again to mind, O ye transgressors.
verses.ct: Keep this in mind and stand firm. Think it over carefully, you rebels.

verses.kjv: Remember the former things of old: for I am God, and there is none else; I am God, and there is none like me,
verses.ct: Recall what happened long ago, because I am God, and there is no other. I am God, and no one is like me.

verses.kjv: Declaring the end from the beginning, and from ancient times the things that are not yet done, saying, My counsel shall stand, and I will do all my pleasure:
verses.ct: I announce the outcome from the very start, and from ancient times I reveal what has not yet happened. I say: my plan will stand, and I will accomplish everything I intend.

verses.kjv: Calling a ravenous bird from the east, the man that executeth my counsel from a far country: yea, I have spoken it, I will also bring it to pass; I have purposed it, I will also do it.
verses.ct: I am summoning a bird of prey from the east — a man from a distant land who will carry out my plan. What I have spoken, I will make happen. What I have determined, I will accomplish.

verses.kjv: Hearken unto me, ye stouthearted, that are far from righteousness:
verses.ct: Listen to me, you stubborn people who are so far from righteousness:

verses.kjv: I bring near my righteousness; it shall not be far off, and my salvation shall not tarry: and I will place salvation in Zion for Israel my glory.
verses.ct: I am bringing my righteousness near — it is not far away. My salvation will not be delayed. I will establish salvation in Zion, and I will give my glory to Israel.
